global.description: Configuration data for VxLAN global capability configuration

enable-vxlan.description: Use this attribute to enable VxLAN module. Without this attribute vxlan functionality can not be achieved

vtep-ipv4.description: Use this attribute to set source vtep global ip address. This will be treated at vxlan tunnel source address

mac-ageing-timer.description: Use this attribute to set the time till a learned mac address will persist after last update

arp-nd-refresh-timer.description: Use this attribute to configure aging out the arp-cache and nd-cache entries for given time multiplied by 3 in secs.

mac-address.description: Use this attribute to set the mac address with arp-nd refresh-timer

maximum-cache-disable-count.description: Use this command to configure the maximum number of ARP and ND cache disables on access ports configured with the port+VLAN options. This command does not limit the ARP and ND cache disables on access ports created with only the port option.

enable-vxlan.description: Use this attribute to enable VxLAN module. Without this attribute vxlan functionality can not be achieved

vtep-ipv4.description: Use this attribute to set source vtep global ip address. This will be treated at vxlan tunnel source address

mac-ageing-timer.description: Use this attribute to set the time till a learned mac address will persist after last update

arp-nd-refresh-timer.description: Use this attribute to configure aging out the arp-cache and nd-cache entries for given time multiplied by 3 in secs.

mac-address.description: Use this attribute to set the mac address with arp-nd refresh-timer

maximum-cache-disable-count.description: Use this command to configure the maximum number of ARP and ND cache disables on access ports configured with the port+VLAN options. This command does not limit the ARP and ND cache disables on access ports created with only the port option.

qos-tunnel-mappings.description: QoS tunnel mapping list enclosing container

qos-tunnel-mapping.description: VxLAN QoS configuration for mapping direction and profile

qos-map-mode.description: Use this attribute to set VxLAN-QoS Map Mode for overlay dscp

traffic-direction.description: Use this attribute to set global direction(ingress/egress) for VxLAN. Ingreess means traffic coming to network side and egress means traffic going out from network side
Use this attribute to set global direction(ingress/egress) for VxLAN. Ingreess means traffic coming to network side and egress means traffic going out from network side

qos-map-mode.description: Use this attribute to set VxLAN-QoS Map Mode for overlay dscp

profile-name.description: Use this attribute to map QOS profile name. This profile name should be already configured before mapping it to vxlan tunnel

traffic-direction.description: Use this attribute to set global direction(ingress/egress) for VxLAN. Ingreess means traffic coming to network side and egress means traffic going out from network side

qos-map-mode.description: Use this attribute to set VxLAN-QoS Map Mode for overlay dscp

profile-name.description: Use this attribute to map QOS profile name. This profile name should be already configured before mapping it to vxlan tunnel

vxlan-identifier.description: Use this attribute to add a tenant and the type of VPN

vrf-name.description: Use this attribute to map VRF to carry EVPN routes. This defines BGP as the mechanism for host reachability advertisement.

mac-hold-timer.description: Use this attribute to set the time a host mac entry will persist after unconfiguring. Hold time range -1 to 300 in seconds. -1(never expire)

tenant-description.description: Use this attribute to set VxLAN identifier name

irb-name.description: Use this attribute to to configure default gateway behavior on a VTEP for particular VNID.

map-network.description: Use this attribute to map a tunnel to the tenant

vxlan-identifier.description: Use this attribute to add a tenant and the type of VPN

tenant-type.description: Use this attribute to create tenant with multicast tunnel

xconnect-identifier.description: Use this attribute to create Xconnect tenant

tenant-xconnect-type.description: Use this attribute to create tenant with different type of tunnel

mac-only.description: Use this attribute to show count of MAC Only Entries

destination-interface.description: Use this attribute to show destination connection of tunnel

connection-type.description: Use this attribute to show the type of network connection

connection-status.description: Use this attribute to show status of network connection

Use this attribute to set advertise host to route

mac-address.description: Use this attribute to know MAC address of the host.create a static route to reach a destination MAC in the VXLAN forwarding table. This command helps to supports different tenants so that they can have the same MAC/IP, but different VNIDs.This command is required for unicast tunnels to map the remote VTEP

in-packets.description: This indicates total number of packets received on tunnel interface

tx-arp-discard-packets.description: This Object describes Arp Discarded Packets

tx-nd-discard-packets.description: This Object describes Nd Discarded Packets

tx-arp-request-packets.description: This Object describes Arp request Transmitted Packets

tx-arp-reply-packets.description: This Object describes Arp reply Transmitted Packets

untagged-interface-name.description: Use this attribute to map a physical interface to identify the tenant traffic and to enter NVO access interface mode

interface-name.description: Use this attribute to map a physical interface to identify the tenant traffic and to enter NVO access interface mode

admin-shutdown.description: Use this attribute to shutdown vxlan access interface

description.description: Use this attribute to set description of access interface

dynamic-learning-disable.description: Use this attribute to disable dynamic learning of MACs at the access port. This command also disables dynamic learning of MAC/IP from ARP/ND messages received on this access port.

access-mac-hold-time.description: Use this attribute to set the time a host mac entry will persist after unconfiguring. The feature holds the MAC in hardware until BGP has withdrawn from the neighbors. This helps to reduce flooding to other access ports. This setting applies when the access port is shut down, the physical port on which the access port is down, or the access port is removed from the VNID using the no form of the map vnid command. When the MAC hold time is configured as -1, then the MAC is not removed from the hardware and is also not withdrawn from EVPN BGP

arp-nd-flood-suppress.description: Use this attribute to restrict the flood of ARP/ND packets towards remote VTEPs or other access ports.This command applies only when the ARP cache and ND cache are enabled. When the ARP cache is disabled, ARP flooding is not suppressed even if this command is given. When the ND cache is disabled, ND flooding is not disabled, even if this command is given

garp-gna-enable.description: Use this attribute to allow garp-gna packets advertisement

mac-address.description: Use this attribute to set the static mac address of host

default-access-interface.description: Use this attribute to create default access interface

untagged-interface-name.description: Use this attribute to map a physical interface to identify the tenant traffic and to enter NVO access interface mode for untagged access-if

interface-name.description: Use this attribute to map a physical interface to identify the tenant traffic and to enter NVO access interface mode

admin-shutdown.description: Use this attribute to shutdown vxlan access interface

description.description: Use this attribute to set description of access interface

dynamic-learning-disable.description: Use this attribute to disable dynamic learning of MACs at the access port. This command also disables dynamic learning of MAC/IP from ARP/ND messages received on this access port.

access-mac-hold-time.description: Use this attribute to set the time a host mac entry will persist after unconfiguring. The feature holds the MAC in hardware until BGP has withdrawn from the neighbors. This helps to reduce flooding to other access ports. This setting applies when the access port is shut down, the physical port on which the access port is down, or the access port is removed from the VNID using the no form of the map vnid command. When the MAC hold time is configured as -1, then the MAC is not removed from the hardware and is also not withdrawn from EVPN BGP

arp-nd-flood-suppress.description: Use this attribute to restrict the flood of ARP/ND packets towards remote VTEPs or other access ports.This command applies only when the ARP cache and ND cache are enabled. When the ARP cache is disabled, ARP flooding is not suppressed even if this command is given. When the ND cache is disabled, ND flooding is not disabled, even if this command is given

garp-gna-enable.description: Use this attribute to allow garp-gna packets advertisement

mac-address.description: Use this attribute to set the static mac address of host

default-access-interface.description: Use this attribute to create default access interface

untagged-interface-name.description: Use this attribute to map a physical interface to identify the tenant traffic and to enter NVO access interface mode for untagged access-if

arp-cache-disable.description: Use this attribute to disable the ARP cache for MAC/IP. When the ARP cache is disabled on a VxLAN access port, ZebOS-XP does not reply to any ARP arriving on this port from the cache. ZebOS-XP withdraws all MAC/IPs configured/learned on this access port and removes the MAC/IP entry for this access port from the local ARP cache. ZebOS-XP also makes sure that on withdrawing the MAC/IP route, the MAC does not become unknown. If all routes for this MAC are being withdrawn because of this command, then ZebOS-XP advertises a MAC-only route. This is done so that the MAC does not become unknown and only the cache functionality becomes disabled.See also nvo vxlan max-cache-disable. Use the no form of this command to enable ARP cache for MAC/IP. Note: On enabling the cache, an IP will be in conflict, then the cache enable will fail. The conflict has to be manually removed and then the cache enabled.

nd-cache-disable.description: Use this attribute to disable ND cache for MAC/IPv6. When the ARP cache is disabled on a VxLAN access port, ZebOS-XP does not reply to any ARP arriving on this port from the cache. ZebOS-XP withdraws all MAC/IPs configured/learned on this access port and removes the MAC/IP entry for this access port from the local ARP cache. ZebOS-XP also makes sure that on withdrawing the MAC/IP route, the MAC does not become unknown. If all routes for this MAC are being withdrawn because of this command, then ZebOS-XP advertises a MAC-only route. This is done so that the MAC does not become unknown and only the cache functionality becomes disabled. Use the no form of this command to enable ND cache for MAC/IPv6. Note: On enabling the cache, an IP will be in conflict, then the cache enable will fail. The conflict has to be manually removed and then the cache enabled.

ZebOS-XP also makes sure that on withdrawing the MAC/IP route, the MAC does not become unknown. If all routes for this MAC are being withdrawn because of this command, then ZebOS-XP advertises a MAC-only route. This is done so that the MAC does not become unknown and only the cache functionality becomes disabled.See also nvo vxlan max-cache-disable. Use the no form of this command to enable ARP cache for MAC/IP. Note: On enabling the cache, an IP will be in conflict, then the cache enable will fail. The conflict has to be manually removed and then the cache enabled.

nd-cache-disable.description: Use this attribute to disable ND cache for MAC/IPv6. When the ARP cache is disabled on a VxLAN access port, ZebOS-XP does not reply to any ARP arriving on this port from the cache. ZebOS-XP withdraws all MAC/IPs configured/learned on this access port and removes the MAC/IP entry for this access port from the local ARP cache. ZebOS-XP also makes sure that on withdrawing the MAC/IP route, the MAC does not become unknown. If all routes for this MAC are being withdrawn because of this command, then ZebOS-XP advertises a MAC-only route. This is done so that the MAC does not become unknown and only the cache functionality becomes disabled. Use the no form of this command to enable ND cache for MAC/IPv6. Note: On enabling the cache, an IP will be in conflict, then the cache enable will fail. The conflict has to be manually removed and then the cache enabled.

This setting applies when the access port is shut down, the physical port on which the access port is down, or the access port is removed from the VNID using the no form of the map vnid command. When the MAC hold time is configured as -1, then the MAC is not removed from the hardware and is also not withdrawn from EVPN BGP

arp-nd-flood-suppress.description: Use this attribute to restrict the flood of ARP/ND packets towards remote VTEPs or other access ports.This command applies only when the ARP cache and ND cache are enabled. When the ARP cache is disabled, ARP flooding is not suppressed even if this command is given. When the ND cache is disabled, ND flooding is not disabled, even if this command is given

garp-gna-enable.description: Use this attribute to allow garp-gna packets advertisement

mac-address.description: Use this attribute to set the static mac address of host

vlan-identifier.description: S-VLAN on which interface is mapped

inner-vlan-identifier.description: Use this attriute to map VLAN'S on an interface to identify the tenant traffic and to enter NVO access interface mode

tag-protocol-identifier.description: Use this attribute to set the Tpid for the outer vlan. Ox88A8: IEEE 802.1ad Provider Bridging and Ox9100: IEEE 802.1Q VLAN-tagged frame with double tagging

interface-name.description: Use this attribute to map a physical interface to identify the tenant traffic and to enter NVO access interface mode

admin-shutdown.description: Use this attribute to shutdown vxlan access interface

description.description: Use this attribute to set description of access interface

dynamic-learning-disable.description: Use this attribute to disable dynamic learning of MACs at the access port. This command also disables dynamic learning of MAC/IP from ARP/ND messages received on this access port.

access-mac-hold-time.description: Use this attribute to set the time a host mac entry will persist after unconfiguring. The feature holds the MAC in hardware until BGP has withdrawn from the neighbors. This helps to reduce flooding to other access ports. This setting applies when the access port is shut down, the physical port on which the access port is down, or the access port is removed from the VNID using the no form of the map vnid command. When the MAC hold time is configured as -1, then the MAC is not removed from the hardware and is also not withdrawn from EVPN BGP

arp-nd-flood-suppress.description: Use this attribute to restrict the flood of ARP/ND packets towards remote VTEPs or other access ports.This command applies only when the ARP cache and ND cache are enabled. When the ARP cache is disabled, ARP flooding is not suppressed even if this command is given. When the ND cache is disabled, ND flooding is not disabled, even if this command is given

garp-gna-enable.description: Use this attribute to allow garp-gna packets advertisement

mac-address.description: Use this attribute to set the static mac address of host

vlan-identifier.description: S-VLAN on which interface is mapped

inner-vlan-identifier.description: Use this attriute to map VLAN'S on an interface to identify the tenant traffic and to enter NVO access interface mode

vxlan-identifier.description: Use this attribute to map a tenant to an access-port

tenant-description.description: Use this attribute to map VXLAN Identifier Name

state.description: Operational state data for VxLAN identifier

vxlan-identifier.description: Use this attribute to map a tenant to an access-port

tenant-description.description: Use this attribute to map VXLAN Identifier Name

arp-cache-disable.description: Use this attribute to disable the ARP cache for MAC/IP. When the ARP cache is disabled on a VxLAN access port, ZebOS-XP does not reply to any ARP arriving on this port from the cache. ZebOS-XP withdraws all MAC/IPs configured/learned on this access port and removes the MAC/IP entry for this access port from the local ARP cache. ZebOS-XP also makes sure that on withdrawing the MAC/IP route, the MAC does not become unknown. If all routes for this MAC are being withdrawn because of this command, then ZebOS-XP advertises a MAC-only route. This is done so that the MAC does not become unknown and only the cache functionality becomes disabled.See also nvo vxlan max-cache-disable. Use the no form of this command to enable ARP cache for MAC/IP. Note: On enabling the cache, an IP will be in conflict, then the cache enable will fail. The conflict has to be manually removed and then the cache enabled.

nd-cache-disable.description: Use this attribute to disable ND cache for MAC/IPv6. When the ARP cache is disabled on a VxLAN access port, ZebOS-XP does not reply to any ARP arriving on this port from the cache. ZebOS-XP withdraws all MAC/IPs configured/learned on this access port and removes the MAC/IP entry for this access port from the local ARP cache. ZebOS-XP also makes sure that on withdrawing the MAC/IP route, the MAC does not become unknown. If all routes for this MAC are being withdrawn because of this command, then ZebOS-XP advertises a MAC-only route. This is done so that the MAC does not become unknown and only the cache functionality becomes disabled. Use the no form of this command to enable ND cache for MAC/IPv6. Note: On enabling the cache, an IP will be in conflict, then the cache enable will fail. The conflict has to be manually removed and then the cache enabled.

state.description: Operational state data for ARP/ND cache

arp-cache-disable.description: Use this attribute to disable the ARP cache for MAC/IP. When the ARP cache is disabled on a VxLAN access port, ZebOS-XP does not reply to any ARP arriving on this port from the cache. ZebOS-XP withdraws all MAC/IPs configured/learned on this access port and removes the MAC/IP entry for this access port from the local ARP cache. ZebOS-XP also makes sure that on withdrawing the MAC/IP route, the MAC does not become unknown. If all routes for this MAC are being withdrawn because of this command, then ZebOS-XP advertises a MAC-only route. This is done so that the MAC does not become unknown and only the cache functionality becomes disabled.See also nvo vxlan max-cache-disable. Use the no form of this command to enable ARP cache for MAC/IP. Note: On enabling the cache, an IP will be in conflict, then the cache enable will fail. The conflict has to be manually removed and then the cache enabled.

nd-cache-disable.description: Use this attribute to disable ND cache for MAC/IPv6. When the ARP cache is disabled on a VxLAN access port, ZebOS-XP does not reply to any ARP arriving on this port from the cache. ZebOS-XP withdraws all MAC/IPs configured/learned on this access port and removes the MAC/IP entry for this access port from the local ARP cache. ZebOS-XP also makes sure that on withdrawing the MAC/IP route, the MAC does not become unknown. If all routes for this MAC are being withdrawn because of this command, then ZebOS-XP advertises a MAC-only route. This is done so that the MAC does not become unknown and only the cache functionality becomes disabled. Use the no form of this command to enable ND cache for MAC/IPv6. Note: On enabling the cache, an IP will be in conflict, then the cache enable will fail. The conflict has to be manually removed and then the cache enabled.
